title: Asafotufiam Festival
description: Commemorates the victories of the 'Asafo' warrior companies, a state festival honoring the Ga-Dangme people.
insiderTip: Visit the Torgbui Akorli shrine to learn more about the history of the festival.

title: Oguaa Fetu Afahye
description: A vibrant festival celebrated by the Oguaa people of Cape Coast to thank the 77 deities of the Oguaa traditional area.
insiderTip: The durbar of chiefs on the final Saturday is the main event. Get there early for a good spot.

title: Hogbetsotso Festival
description: Celebrates the migration of the Anlo Ewes from their ancestral home in Togo to their current location in Ghana.
insiderTip: A great time to experience Ewe culture, music, and dance.

title: Chale Wote Street Art Festival
description: A vibrant street art festival transforming the streets of James Town with graffiti, installations, music, dance, and cultural exhibitions.
insiderTip: Arrive on the main weekend for the most vibrant street parades, live performances, and mural art battles. Bring cash for art markets and food vendors.

title: Homowo Festival
description: The annual festival of the Ga people, celebrated to 'hoot at hunger'. Involves traditional rituals and processions.
insiderTip: The main celebrations happen on Saturdays. Ask for permission before taking photos of chiefs.

title: Edina Bakatue Festival
description: A purification festival for the Benya Lagoon in Elmina, marking the start of the new fishing season.
insiderTip: Watch the regatta on the lagoon and the procession of chiefs.

title: Aboakyer Festival
description: A deer hunting festival of the Effutu people in Winneba to appease the gods.
insiderTip: The deer hunt is the main attraction, followed by a grand durbar.

title: Kundum Festival
description: A harvest festival of the Ahanta and Nzema people, marked with drumming, dancing, and feasting.
insiderTip: The festival moves between towns, check local schedules.

title: Damba Festival
description: A major festival of the people of the northern regions, celebrating the birth and naming of the Prophet Mohammed.
insiderTip: Witness the spectacular display of horsemanship and traditional costumes.

title: Fetu Afahye
description: A festival of the people of Cape Coast, similar to Oguaa Fetu Afahye, celebrated with a grand durbar of chiefs.
insiderTip: Experience the rich culture and traditions of the Fante people.

title: Odwira Festival
description: A spiritual cleansing festival of the Akan people, particularly in Akropong, to purify the land and people.
insiderTip: A very solemn and spiritual event. Be respectful of the traditions.

title: Akwambo Festival
description: A 'path clearing' festival to commemorate the clearing of footpaths to farms and rivers by ancestors.
insiderTip: Join the community in their celebrations and communal labor.

title: Kloyosikplemi Festival
description: A harvest and thanksgiving festival of the people of Yilo Krobo.
insiderTip: Witness the display of Krobo culture and the beautiful glass beads.

title: Bugum Chugu (Fire Festival)
description: Commemorates the search for a lost prince and is celebrated with a procession of people carrying torches.
insiderTip: An amazing spectacle at night, but be careful with the fire.
